dt: {bc}the act or process of {a_link|competing} {bc}{sx|rivalry||}: such as
{bc}the effort of two or more parties acting independently to secure the business of a third party by offering the most favorable terms

dt.t: contractors in {wi}competition{/wi} for the contract to build the new school

dt: {bc}active demand by two or more organisms or kinds of organisms for some environmental resource in short supply

shortdef: the act or process of competing : rivalry: such as
the effort of two or more parties acting independently to secure the business of a third party by offering the most favorable terms
active demand by two or more organisms or kinds of organisms for some environmental resource in short supply

dt.t: These products are {it}in competition with{/it} each other.

dt: {bc}a person or group that one is trying to succeed against {bc}a person or group that one is competing with

dt.t: He sized up {it}the competition{/it} looking to see who his toughest opponent would likely be.
Don't let {it}the competition{/it} know our trade secrets.
In my opinion, this restaurant {it}has no competition{/it}. It's so much better that all the others.

shortdef: a person or group that one is trying to succeed against : a person or group that one is competing with
